body:
J'cuse coarse nfs time stamps. 

> On 11 May 2016, at 21:32, Gregory Shimansky <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!
> 
> What version of Go are you using (go version)?
> go version devel +c1e8892 Wed May 11 08:30:53 2016 +0000 linux/amd64
> 
> What operating system and processor architecture are you using (go env)?
> GOARCH="amd64"
> GOBIN=""
> GOEXE=""
> GOHOSTARCH="amd64"
> GOHOSTOS="linux"
> GOOS="linux"
> GOPATH="/nfs/ims/home/gashiman/work/gopath"
> GORACE=""
> GOROOT="/nfs/site/disks/ms-ssg_dpd_tcar_sat/users/gashiman/golang"
> GOTOOLDIR="/nfs/site/disks/ms-ssg_dpd_tcar_sat/users/gashiman/golang/pkg/tool/linux_amd64"
> CC="gcc"
> GOGCCFLAGS="-fPIC -m64 -pthread -fmessage-length=0 -fdebug-prefix-map=/tmp/go-build054107870=/tmp/go-build -gno-record-gcc-switches"
> CXX="g++"
> CGO_ENABLED="1"
> 
> What did you do? If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error. A complete runnable program is good. A link on play.golang.org is best.
> When I run all.bash I always get a test failure on Fedora 22. All packages are updated to their most recent versions, so kernel build is 4.4.8-200.fc22.x86_64.
> 
> What did you expect to see?
> Passed test. It passes for me on other linuxes like Ubuntu 15.04 and RHEL 6.6.
> 
> What did you see instead?
> `--- FAIL: TestPackageMainTestImportsArchiveNotBinary (1.92s)
> go_test.go:244: running testgo [test main_test]
> go_test.go:259: standard output:
> go_test.go:260: ok main_test 0.001s
> 
>     go_test.go:244: running testgo [install main_test]
>     go_test.go:244: running testgo [list -f {{.Stale}}:{{.StaleReason}} main_test]
>     go_test.go:259: standard output:
>     go_test.go:260: true:newer source file
> 
>     go_test.go:559: after go install, main listed as stale
> FAIL
> FAIL cmd/go 67.935s
> `
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
>
